Reviews.Title: “Greatest small hotel we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: tedssudsandspuds
Reviews.Content: This family owned hotel and cafe in Barcelona, spain was outstanding in all respects, close to everything. Couldn't ask for more and as a bonus super rates...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alicia R
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. We stayed one night after our cruise. The hotel is very basic but clean and reasonably priced. The staff is wonderful. Very accommodating. English is a second language for them and our Spanish/Catalan is very limited and we were able to communicate well. Word of warning. If you do not travel "light", our room was on the second floor and there is no elevator. You could be hauling heavy bags up and down the staircase. Also, because this is a great neighborhood spot, there is street noise. Be warned if you cannot sleep in a somewhat noisy location.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: BirdOrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location for Barcelona sightseeing. To the Barceloneta beach, one can walk in 15-20 min. The Zoo and Cuitadela Park are situated nearby. Many sights, including Gothic Quarter, Catalonia Square, Ramblas and the port are not far, too. Metro station Arc de Triomphe (about 300 m from the hotel) enables you to go to the other parts of the city. The room is not big, but clean and cozy. We lived in a room facing the yard, but the yard is narrow and dark, so it's like having no window. From the other side, rooms facing yard are cheaper. The staff is friendly, and helped us a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent food, a real neighborhood spot"”
Reviews.Author: KM240
Reviews.Content: This is a family run operation, and has been in the neighborhood a long time. Locals gather regularly for coffee in the AM and wine and tapas at night. You quickly feel like a part of the neighborhood. The staff was very friendly - even when you didn't speak Spanish/Catalon (and they, English) - they were helpful, and made you feel at home. The food was excellent. If you don't want to be in the "middle of things" but with perfect access to beach, (20 minute walk), great Metro station location, beautiful park, and the Old Town and all amenities - this is the place. This is why I rate it Very Good. I would stay here again. However, the rooms are bare bones - they are clean, AC works great, but they are very very basic. No fridge in rooms, and not a fancy "design-focused " hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont understand poor rating”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst on a tight budget, taking a bit of chance because of its poor rating. It was ideal. Located just away from main touristy area but within easy walking distance of El Born, Barri Gotic, La Rambla, the port, etc. For the price, you could not have asked for more. Two of us sharing a twin room paid about £35 each. It was clean, had air conditioning (which was very much appreciated), friendly helpful staff, nice breakfast. All in all, tremendous value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but do NOT go here during meal times”
Reviews.Author: svk04
Reviews.Content: The location was very good and central. The staff in the morning and evening were very helpful. Though the staff at the reception in the evening did not speak any English, we were able to communicate using Google translate :) However, if you land here during lunch time (when the restaurant is busy) - the service is terrible and it takes hours to get anyone's attention even to check in in spite of informing the hotel of your arrival time. We waited for about an hour to check in and then again for a really long time to ask a question that needed only 30 seconds to reply.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate rooms but an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: westli
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for just one night. The rooms are very small and the bathroom even tinier. However the windows overlooked the beautiful Ciudadela Park. The restaurant at the hotel is a great palce for a drink, or breakfast. We chose this hotel for its close proximity to Estacion de Nord (bus station) which was a short walk away and very convenient. for our trip to the Costa Brava.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love!”
Reviews.Author: slwityk
Reviews.Content: Great! this little hotel is just perfect from the staff to the food, location, and ambience. Can't wait to return to Barcelona and stay with them again. The best tapas in Barcelona. Have recommended to friends who have also stayed there and loved it. Lobster soup .. go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, cute and within easy reach of the city centre”
Reviews.Author: MoPad
Reviews.Content: The room and bath were very small, but clean and comfortable. The room gave onto the street so we had advantages and disadvantages: the street could be noisy sometimes but it was usually a quite area as for traffic. On the other hand, we had a great view on the park just across the street and the charming Castell dels Tres Dragons. There's an inconvenience, which is the rooms don't have an independent entrance from the restaurant on ground floor, so we didn't have keys to enter the B&B but we had to ring the bell, at any hour, and a custodian would wake up and open the door for us. The location was great, just ten minutes walk from the metro station Arc de Triomf and eleven from the Estación del Nord that has buses connecting the city with the Girona airport. The city centre as well was within easy reach, even on foot, and the Parc de la Ciutadella - just across the street - is worth a visit as it features the zoo, the regional parliament and the Cascada fountain built for the Expo more than one century ago. Prices on average (accommodation in Barcelona can be quite expensive, especially in summer, so this was quite a cheap choice). Note: If allowed, I would have rated it 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “do not get room 113”
Reviews.Author: dagsUk
Reviews.Content: it is directly above the kitchen fridge which rattled and vibrated 24hrs a day....not much sleep here...apart from this its a great lettle hotel with food/wine to match (and cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in a Quiet Yet Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: KNewY0rker
Reviews.Content: I staryed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of a wandering trip through Catalonia, French and Spanish sides, and then again for one night before catching my flight back to the United States. I really liked it, and would recommend it to any serious budget traveler. I paid 65 euros, which included all taxes, for an exterior room with a large window, that I believe was double-glazed to block out street noise. At least I wasn't bothered by street noise. In late July, early August, all I really wanted was air conditioning and a private bath. And cleanliness. I got all of these. I also liked the location. Quiet, facing a beautiful park, but no more than a 15-minute walk to the more heavier-trafficked tourist areas. It's metro stop is Arc de Tirumphe, on the convenient No. 1 metro line. It's near Estacio Nord, which is great if you're taking buses to other areas in northern Catalonia, and France. And a stone's throw from the Chocolate Museum, El Born. La Ribera, the Caterina market, and walking distance to Barceloneta. Location t was one of the reasons I chose it. Yes, there was some noise at night. You will hear banging doors, but it doesn't last long, and at these pirces, you need to adjust your expectations. I recommendi this hotel as a great value for budget-conscious travelers, who might enjoy a more local, but still convenient, neighborhood. The hotel is really about 30 rooms above a very good, established traditional-style restaurant. You'll have to drag your bags up a flight of stairs, but both times I had to do this, help was graciously offered. I thought the restaurant was excellent. Tradtional, hearty , good food--huge portions at reasonable prices. Not chic and hip, but very good. The real thing. At least it seemed that way to me. I want to single out one staff member, whose name I believe was Yolanda--she's multilingual--English, French, of course Spanish, and likely Catalan, and goodness knows what other languages. So if I have your name wrong, you know who you are. She helped me enormously (my Spanish is limited), always with extreme graciousness, and really made my stay a lot easier. The hotel offers Internet service in the lobby. Ok, I think it should improve its ability to print boarding passes for passengers, but this is minor. Again, this is not the Ritz, or any other 5-star hotel. But if you're watching your budget, and like quiet neighborhoods that are still convenient, and safe, his is an excellent choice. I agree with the very positive Frommer reivew. A great value for the price. I'll likely be back in December.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelingfrog11
Reviews.Content: We spent our first two nights in Spain at La Ciudadela and you couldn't ask for a better place. Perfectly situated across the street from the parc de la ciudadela and down the street from the arc de triumph, La Ciudadela is in a prime location in the center city. With just a 15 to 20 minute walk to Las Ramblas, 10 minutes to the port and Barceloneta, and 5 minutes to the Gothic Quarter, you won't even need the nearby subway station. La Ciudadela even has its own cafe where you can grab a quick cafe con lechee or a hearty huevos rancheros before hitting the city or just sit back with an ice cold cerveza and people watch. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable (can be a little loud at night) and the staff is friendly and helpful. The next time I am in Barcelona, I will definitely stay here...and maybe request a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel! Really nice people, clean rooms and a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: BareboatSailor
Reviews.Content: A great deal! Stayed with friends before a recent Celebrity Cruise. We booked two rooms and were greated with great hospitality, really nice people and clean and comfortable rooms. The food in the restaurant was great. The location is beautiful near the wonderful park. Transportation is right outside the door with bus and metro service. You can easily walk to the old town from this hotel located in a nice part of town! They even arranged to get a bag we accidentally left behind sent to the ship (on short order) before we sailed! A great place and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: travelstudmuffin
Reviews.Content: while the price is low cira 80 euros, i think for the money you can do much better elsewhere with some work. Rooms are clean , staff is somewhat friendly although english is relatively poor , location is great althogh very noisy but rooms are tiny tiny , there is no lobby basicaly you are just in a tiny room above the restaurant . Room is clean but very simple shower s don't work well , towels feel like a brillo pad and they give you the tiniest cheapest bar of soap i ve ever seen . So while the price is reasonable i think for a little more money or around the same amount of money you could do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities, location, and staff; but noisy for the light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: fred137
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my father for a few nights. The facilities, location, and staff were all great value. I was very pleased we had air conditioning. However, whilst my father slept soundly every night with no problems, I found the place very noisy even though we had an inside room and we couldn't hear the traffic. Every night I was woken by people coming in after midnight till as late 03:00 hr in the morning. The hard floors echoed every footstep in the corridors and rooms, and the doors to all the rooms could only be closed by slamming them hard. Furthermore, on a couple of nights there were people talking loudly in the corridor at the tops of their voices at 02:00 hr seemingly oblivious to anyone sleeping nearby. Maybe I was just unlucky while we were there, or maybe the hotel attracts a group of regulars who feel it's acceptable to behave like that. I only managed to sleep with the aid of helicopter ear plugs! Nevertheless, my father liked it and would probably give it 4/5. Along with my 2/5 that makes an average score of 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicol21
Reviews.Content: We went there in 4 people, all we wanted was a clean and tidy place to sleep. the hotel was ok, well located. Staff with basic english but nice people. Rooms were clean and quite nice, bathroom as well. We got rooms with "back windows' which ment that we couldn't really open them - the view was internal, very tiny , kind of square..... But since we just slept there it was ok. And it was very quite in the room because windows were not facing streets. Breakfast was ok, fresh with great coffie. If someone is looking for good place to sleep and rest I can recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roseanne2
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Ciudadela is an old hotel, basic and clean. It is located opposite Ciudadela parque which is very nice and its about a15min walk to Las Ramblas. We enjoyed the location being a little out of the main noisy streets. The room was basic but had everything you need and the bathroom was old but again clean. The basin drainage was poor which we reported to the cleaning staff. Most of the staff had limited English but were still very helpful and friendly. The cafe is good and I highly recommend the paella - I'd return just for this! I would stay here again. If you are looking for a basic, good value for money hotel I suggest this one but dont expect 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: taniah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an okay location for Barcelona. It was about a 10-15 minute walk from Franca station, where the train from the airport terminates and 10-15 minutes in another direction for an eating area near the Santa Maria del Mar church. Anything else was really a metro ride away, but the Arc de Triomf station is about 5 minutes pleasant walk down the avenue. The room was small, but lovely, even though ours looked out over the busy street corner. The bathroom was clean and spacious with a lovely large shower. The thing that disappointed me most was the staff. We arrived late (approx 11pm) and noticed that the restaurant downstairs was stil busy. We asked at check-in when the kitchen closed and was told 30 minutes. When we returned 10 minutes later we were told the kitchen was closed. So we wandered out and found a take-away for a sandwich and some chips to return approx 30 minutes later to find the hotel restaurant still taking orders and serving food. We were very disappointed. Other than that, lovely hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pbman1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a good value for the money. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was great. It was easy to get just about anywhere from there either on foot or by bus which stopped right outside the door. Metro was a short walk away. Room was fairly basic but decent sized. About what you'd expect for this price category.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamBeefy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ciudadela for a couple of nights at the end of September. Excellent location right next to the Gothic quarter and an easy walk to the Ramblas and the beach. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Double room a bit small but pleasant and very clean with nice en-suite. Barcelona itself is a beautiful city and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay although, as you might expect, it is very expensive! Given this Ciudadela is excellent value for money, especially considering it's location. A great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying !”
Reviews.Author: SafariBart
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in beginning of May 08 in this hotel. Location is really good : around 30 minutes walk to the Ramblas, 20 minutes to Barceloneta and being next to Ciudadela Park is also a plus. Note that hotel is also close to Estacio de França, which is the terminus for the train that links airport to city centre. We used this train connection and were happily surprised that it was for free (don't know why). Rooms : there are 13 rooms, which are all situated on the first floor (level above ground floor, I mean). Note that there is no lift, so for disabled persons this will be a problem. There is no real lobby as such : you check in at the counter of the bar / restaurant downstairs. About 8 rooms look out over an avenue towards the park. Note that hotel has two room categories : rooms on outer side of the building and rooms on inner side. 'Exterior' rooms are more expensive (about 12 euros per night). We had 2 double 'exterior' rooms and I wondered if I would book these again : you have indeed a nice view, but on the first night we were woken up by loud voices just below. Somebody thought it were the garbage people who passed by. The three following nights, we did not have this problem anymore. Traffic noise is not disturbing, neither did we hear noise from neighbors. Note that temperature was still moderate : we did not use the airco so cannot comment on how silent this is. I believe that size and decor of inner and outer rooms is similar : limited ! Room size was around 18 square meter max. Our double bed was 140 cm wide, which is significantly smaller then our king size at home, but didn't bother us too much. Have to admit that bathroom was in good shape and shower working well. There are rooms that are a bit larger > ask for a triple room, but you will need to pay more. Normal rate 85 euro per night. We received a 10% discount without even asking for a discount. Probably we got that since we booked 8 nights all together. This rate did not include breakfast. A continental breakfast was available in the restaurant downstairs at 5 euro per person and included a small bottle of orange juice, coffee/tea, a croissant, two slices of toast and butter and jam. Too much bread for me : would have appreciated some fruit or yogurt... Taking into account that I searched a lot for affordable accommodation, but it was difficult to find an acceptable (clean and a little bit comfortable) room below 130 euro. Perhaps because it was a long weekend (May 1) ? Therefore, we were quite happy with Ciudadela Parc. Next time, I might check out some hostels in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: intel_bodhi
Reviews.Content: We've been in Barcelona in mid March, and stayed at La Ciudadela hotel. It is a very nice hotel. Rooms are not big, but for a turist looking to enjoy the town are very good. Personnel was nice and helpful. It is situated close to Metro station and there is a bus station in front. I warmly recommend this hotel to those travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travlnagain
Reviews.Content: I took my daughters to Barcelona for Christmas and we stayed a the La Cuidadela hotel. The location is wonderful! The hotel is an easy walk to the subway, to the Picasso Museum,and to great shops and restaurants. We enjoyed having the park right across the street, it was a great place to relax. Service was friendly, and it was convenient to have the restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position and value”
Reviews.Author: DavideB
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are located on the upper floor, above the hotel restaurant. Location is great, the Ciudadela park is in front of the hotel and it's a 10 minutes walk to the Barri Gothic. It is as near to the touristic center as to be comfortable but as far from the most crowded locations as to be unexpensive and quiet. As suggested by other reviewers we asked for an exterior room. We got the room on the outer corner of the building, exactly above the entrance. The room was spacious enough for a couple, nicely renovated and really clean. It seems to me the room was well soundproofed but it was January, not a lot of the restaurant's customers seated outside. I suppose it won't be a problem during summer. A really great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mghabib
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good location. Quite and next to Ciudadela park, which is a great place to walk and relax. It is a fifteen minute walk from Ramblas. It is also a five minute away from a Touristic Bus stop if you are interested to take this two day tour around the city. Would recommend it for a short stay. But becareful when coming late, staff close the entrance at night, which means ringing teh bell and waiting for them to open.
